explanation: md5_transform: It is called from MHD_MD5_update; inspect its implementation (and its callees) to ensure it does not call memcmp to compare NUL‑terminated strings. __builtin_rotateleft32: A direct callee of md5_transform according to the call graph; include to confirm it (and other low‑level helpers) do not use memcmp for string comparisons. memcpy: Standard library memory copy is used in this function; include it to distinguish usage from memcmp and to confirm no accidental use of memcmp/strcmp semantics. mhd_assert: Macro/function used at the top of MHD_MD5_update; include to ensure the assert implementation does not expand to or call memcmp for string comparisons. struct Md5Ctx (definition): Needed to know the types/semantics of ctx->buffer, ctx->count and ctx->H so you can determine whether the buffer holds textual (NUL‑terminated) data or binary data — key to deciding whether any memcmp usage would be comparing null‑terminated strings. MD5_BLOCK_SIZE: Needed to understand block/buffer sizes and whether data operations could involve NUL terminators or string semantics.
